newsitem.title: UK: BFI down 13 as Panamaxes remain weak.
newsitem.headline: BFI down 13 as Panamaxes remain weak.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) was down 13 on Friday to 1,483 points.
Brokers said that despite continued strength in the Caper market the index fell again on Friday as a result of weaker demand for Panamaxes.

Few enquiries remained from grain charterers for January and owners were said to be indicating $24.75 no combination US Gulf to Japan and $12.75/$13.00 US Gulf to Continent both basis heavy grain for early Februrary. Handy grain rates remained soft.
At 1300 GMT BIFFEX was five points down to one point up and turnover totalled 79 lots.
